controls.label: Does your ML/TF risk assessment consider customer types (including beneficial owners and PEPs)?
controls.detail-label: Describe how you assess customer types, beneficial owners, and politically exposed persons in your ML/TF risk framework

controls.label: Does your ML/TF risk assessment consider customers' sources of funds and wealth?
controls.detail-label: Describe how you assess sources of funds and wealth in your ML/TF risk evaluation

controls.label: Does your ML/TF risk assessment consider the nature and purpose of business relationships with customers?
controls.detail-label: Describe how you evaluate the nature, purpose, and collect relevant information about customer business relationships

controls.label: Does your ML/TF risk assessment consider the control structure of non-individual customers?
controls.detail-label: Describe how you assess the control structure of company, trust, partnership, and association customers

controls.label: Does your ML/TF risk assessment consider the types of designated services you provide?
controls.detail-label: Describe how you incorporate service types into your ML/TF risk assessment

controls.label: Does your ML/TF risk assessment consider the methods by which you deliver designated services?
controls.detail-label: Describe how you evaluate delivery methods (e.g. branch, online, third party) in your ML/TF risk assessment

controls.label: Does your ML/TF risk assessment consider the foreign jurisdictions with which you deal?
controls.detail-label: Describe how you assess ML/TF risk relating to foreign jurisdictions in your dealings

controls.label: Does your AML/CTF program specify different requirements for Individuals (Part 4.2)?
Does your AML/CTF program specify different requirements for Companies (Part 4.3)?
Does your AML/CTF program specify different requirements for Trustee customers (Part 4.4)?
Does your AML/CTF program specify different requirements for Partnership member customers (Part 4.5)?
Does your AML/CTF program specify different requirements for Incorporated or unincorporated associations (Part 4.6)?
Does your AML/CTF program specify different requirements for Registered co-operatives (Part 4.7)?
Does your AML/CTF program specify different requirements for Government bodies (Part 4.8)?
Does your AML/CTF program specify different requirements for beneficial owners (Part 4.12)?
Does your AML/CTF program specify different requirements for politically exposed persons (Part 4.13)?
Does your AML/CTF program comply with document-based verification requirements (Part 4.9)?
Does your AML/CTF program comply with verification from electronic data requirements (Part 4.10)?
Does your AML/CTF program comply with agent requirements (Part 4.11) for agents authorised to act on behalf of customers?
controls.detail-label: Describe how you manage ML/TF risk and verify agents authorised to act for or on behalf of customers

groups.title: ML/TF Risk Factors Assessment
groups.description: Evaluation of the key risk factors your reporting entity must consider when identifying ML/TF risk, including customer types, sources of funds, business relationships, and delivery methods.

groups.title: Program Scope by Customer Type
groups.description: Confirmation that your AML/CTF program addresses different requirements for each customer type you serve.

groups.title: Beneficial Owners and Politically Exposed Persons
groups.description: Special requirements for beneficial owner and PEP identification and assessment within your AML/CTF program.

groups.title: Verification Compliance
groups.description: Confirmation that your AML/CTF program complies with document-based and electronic data verification requirements.

groups.title: Agent Risk Management
groups.description: ML/TF risk management and verification requirements for agents authorised to act on behalf of customers.
